2109  " ...\n"
2110  "}\n"
2111  "\nExamples:\n"
2112  "\nList account balances where there at least 1 confirmation\n"
2113  + HelpExampleCli("listaccounts", "") +
2114  "\nList account balances including zero confirmation transactions\n"
2115  + HelpExampleCli("listaccounts", "0") +
2116  "\nList account balances for 6 or more confirmations\n"
2117  + HelpExampleCli("listaccounts", "6") +
2118  "\nAs json rpc call\n"
2119  + HelpExampleRpc("listaccounts", "6")
2120  );
2121 
2122  // Make sure the results are valid at least up to the most recent block
2123  // the user could have gotten from another RPC command prior to now
2124  pwallet->BlockUntilSyncedToCurrentChain();
2125 
2126  LOCK2(cs_main, pwallet->cs_wallet);
2127 
2128  int nMinDepth = 1;
2129  if (!request.params[0].isNull())
2130  nMinDepth = request.params[0].get_int();
2131  isminefilter includeWatchonly = ISMINE_SPENDABLE;
2132  if(!request.params[1].isNull())
2133  if(request.params[1].get_bool())
2134  includeWatchonly = includeWatchonly | ISMINE_WATCH_ONLY;
2135 
2136  std::map<std::string, CAmount> mapAccountBalances;
2137  for (const std::pair<const CTxDestination, CAddressBookData>& entry : pwallet->mapAddressBook) {
2138  if (IsMine(*pwallet, entry.first) & includeWatchonly) { // This address belongs to me
2139  mapAccountBalances[entry.second.name] = 0;
2140  }
2141  }
2142 
2143  for (const std::pair<const uint256, CWalletTx>& pairWtx : pwallet->mapWallet) {
2144  const CWalletTx& wtx = pairWtx.second;
2145  CAmount nFee;
2146  std::string strSentAccount;
2147  std::list<COutputEntry> listReceived;
2148  std::list<COutputEntry> listSent;
2149  int nDepth = wtx.GetDepthInMainChain();
2150  if (wtx.GetBlocksToMaturity() > 0 || nDepth < 0)
2151  continue;
2152  wtx.GetAmounts(listReceived, listSent, nFee, strSentAccount, includeWatchonly);
2153  mapAccountBalances[strSentAccount] -= nFee;
2154  for (const COutputEntry& s : listSent)
2155  mapAccountBalances[strSentAccount] -= s.amount;
2156  if (nDepth >= nMinDepth)
2157  {
2158  for (const COutputEntry& r : listReceived)
2159  if (pwallet->mapAddressBook.count(r.destination)) {
2160  mapAccountBalances[pwallet->mapAddressBook[r.destination].name] += r.amount;
2161  }
2162  else
2163  mapAccountBalances[""] += r.amount;
2164  }
2165  }
2166 
2167  const std::list<CAccountingEntry>& acentries = pwallet->laccentries;
2168  for (const CAccountingEntry& entry : acentries)
2169  mapAccountBalances[entry.strAccount] += entry.nCreditDebit;
2170 
2171  UniValue ret(UniValue::VOBJ);
2172  for (const std::pair<const std::string, CAmount>& accountBalance : mapAccountBalances) {
2173  ret.pushKV(accountBalance.first, ValueFromAmount(accountBalance.second));
2174  }
2175  return ret;
2176 }

2178 static UniValue listsinceblock(const JSONRPCRequest& request)

2182 
2183  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {

2213  " \"blocktime\": xxx, (numeric) The block time in seconds since epoch (1 Jan 1970 GMT).\n"

2227  " ],\n"
2228  " \"lastblock\": \"lastblockhash\" (string) The hash of the block (target_confirmations-1) from the best block on the main chain. This is typically used to feed back into listsinceblock the next time you call it. So you would generally use a target_confirmations of say 6, so you will be continually re-notified of transactions until they've reached 6 confirmations plus any new ones\n"
2229  "}\n"
2230  "\nExamples:\n"
2231  + HelpExampleCli("listsinceblock", "")
2232  + HelpExampleCli("listsinceblock", "\"000000000000000bacf66f7497b7dc45ef753ee9a7d38571037cdb1a57f663ad\" 6")
2233  + HelpExampleRpc("listsinceblock", "\"000000000000000bacf66f7497b7dc45ef753ee9a7d38571037cdb1a57f663ad\", 6")
2234  );
2235 
2236  // Make sure the results are valid at least up to the most recent block
2237  // the user could have gotten from another RPC command prior to now
2238  pwallet->BlockUntilSyncedToCurrentChain();
2239 
2240  LOCK2(cs_main, pwallet->cs_wallet);
2241 
2242  const CBlockIndex* pindex = nullptr; // Block index of the specified block or the common ancestor, if the block provided was in a deactivated chain.
2243  const CBlockIndex* paltindex = nullptr; // Block index of the specified block, even if it's in a deactivated chain.
2244  int target_confirms = 1;
2245  isminefilter filter = ISMINE_SPENDABLE;
2246 
2247  if (!request.params[0].isNull() && !request.params[0].get_str().empty()) {
2248  uint256 blockId;
2249 
2250  blockId.SetHex(request.params[0].get_str());
2251  paltindex = pindex = LookupBlockIndex(blockId);
2252  if (!pindex) {
2253  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY, "Block not found");
2254  }
2255  if (chainActive[pindex->nHeight] != pindex) {
2256  // the block being asked for is a part of a deactivated chain;
2257  // we don't want to depend on its perceived height in the block
2258  // chain, we want to instead use the last common ancestor
2259  pindex = chainActive.FindFork(pindex);
2260  }
2261  }
2262 
2263  if (!request.params[1].isNull()) {
2264  target_confirms = request.params[1].get_int();
2265 
2266  if (target_confirms < 1) {
2267  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid parameter");
2268  }
2269  }
2270 
2271  if (!request.params[2].isNull() && request.params[2].get_bool()) {
2272  filter = filter | ISMINE_WATCH_ONLY;
2273  }
2274 
2275  bool include_removed = (request.params[3].isNull() || request.params[3].get_bool());
2276 
2277  int depth = pindex ? (1 + chainActive.Height() - pindex->nHeight) : -1;
2278 
2279  UniValue transactions(UniValue::VARR);
2280 
2281  for (const std::pair<const uint256, CWalletTx>& pairWtx : pwallet->mapWallet) {
2282  CWalletTx tx = pairWtx.second;
2283 
2284  if (depth == -1 || tx.GetDepthInMainChain() < depth) {
2285  ListTransactions(pwallet, tx, "*", 0, true, transactions, filter);
2286  }
2287  }
2288 
2289  // when a reorg'd block is requested, we also list any relevant transactions
2290  // in the blocks of the chain that was detached
2291  UniValue removed(UniValue::VARR);
2292  while (include_removed && paltindex && paltindex != pindex) {
2293  CBlock block;
2294  if (!ReadBlockFromDisk(block, paltindex, Params().GetConsensus())) {
2295  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INTERNAL_ERROR, "Can't read block from disk");
2296  }
2297  for (const CTransactionRef& tx : block.vtx) {
2298  auto it = pwallet->mapWallet.find(tx->GetHash());
2299  if (it != pwallet->mapWallet.end()) {
2300  // We want all transactions regardless of confirmation count to appear here,
2301  // even negative confirmation ones, hence the big negative.
2302  ListTransactions(pwallet, it->second, "*", -100000000, true, removed, filter);
2303  }
2304  }
2305  paltindex = paltindex->pprev;
2306  }
2307 
2308  CBlockIndex *pblockLast = chainActive[chainActive.Height() + 1 - target_confirms];
2309  uint256 lastblock = pblockLast ? pblockLast->GetBlockHash() : uint256();
2310 
2311  UniValue ret(UniValue::VOBJ);
2312  ret.pushKV("transactions", transactions);
2313  if (include_removed) ret.pushKV("removed", removed);
2314  ret.pushKV("lastblock", lastblock.GetHex());
2315 
2316  return ret;
2317 }

2375  pwallet->BlockUntilSyncedToCurrentChain();

2378 
2379  uint256 hash;
2380  hash.SetHex(request.params[0].get_str());
2381 
2382  isminefilter filter = ISMINE_SPENDABLE;
2383  if(!request.params[1].isNull())
2384  if(request.params[1].get_bool())
2385  filter = filter | ISMINE_WATCH_ONLY;
2386

2388  auto it = pwallet->mapWallet.find(hash);
2389  if (it == pwallet->mapWallet.end()) {
2390  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY, "Invalid or non-wallet transaction id");
2391  }

2393 
2394  CAmount nCredit = wtx.GetCredit(filter);
2395  CAmount nDebit = wtx.GetDebit(filter);
2396  CAmount nNet = nCredit - nDebit;
2397  CAmount nFee = (wtx.IsFromMe(filter) ? wtx.tx->GetValueOut() - nDebit : 0);
2398 
2399  entry.pushKV("amount", ValueFromAmount(nNet - nFee));
2400  if (wtx.IsFromMe(filter))
2401  entry.pushKV("fee", ValueFromAmount(nFee));
2402 
2403  WalletTxToJSON(wtx, entry);
2404 
2405  UniValue details(UniValue::VARR);
2406  ListTransactions(pwallet, wtx, "*", 0, false, details, filter);
2407  entry.pushKV("details", details);
2408 
2409  std::string strHex = EncodeHexTx(*wtx.tx, RPCSerializationFlags());
2410  entry.pushKV("hex", strHex);
2411 
2412  return entry;
2413 }

2415 static UniValue abandontransaction(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
2416 {

2419 
2420  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {

2428  "This will mark this transaction and all its in-wallet descendants as abandoned which will allow\n"
2429  "for their inputs to be respent. It can be used to replace \"stuck\" or evicted transactions.\n"
2430  "It only works on transactions which are not included in a block and are not currently in the mempool.\n"

2437  + HelpExampleRpc("abandontransaction", "\"1075db55d416d3ca199f55b6084e2115b9345e16c5cf302fc80e9d5fbf5d48d\"")
2438  );
2439  }
2440 
2441  // Make sure the results are valid at least up to the most recent block
2442  // the user could have gotten from another RPC command prior to now
2443  pwallet->BlockUntilSyncedToCurrentChain();
2444 
2445  LOCK2(cs_main, pwallet->cs_wallet);
2446 
2447  uint256 hash;
2448  hash.SetHex(request.params[0].get_str());
2449 
2450  if (!pwallet->mapWallet.count(hash)) {
2451  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY, "Invalid or non-wallet transaction id");
2452  }
2453  if (!pwallet->AbandonTransaction(hash)) {
2454  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY, "Transaction not eligible for abandonment");
2455  }
2456 
2457  return NullUniValue;
2458 }

2496 static UniValue keypoolrefill(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
2497 {
2498  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
2499  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
2500 
2501  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
2502  return NullUniValue;
2503  }
2504 
2505  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() > 1)
2506  throw std::runtime_error(
2507  "keypoolrefill ( newsize )\n"
2508  "\nFills the keypool."
2509  + HelpRequiringPassphrase(pwallet) + "\n"
2510  "\nArguments\n"
2511  "1. newsize (numeric, optional, default=100) The new keypool size\n"
2512  "\nExamples:\n"
2513  + HelpExampleCli("keypoolrefill", "")
2514  + HelpExampleRpc("keypoolrefill", "")
2515  );
2516 
2517  if (pwallet->IsWalletFlagSet(WALLET_FLAG_DISABLE_PRIVATE_KEYS)) {
2518  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, "Error: Private keys are disabled for this wallet");
2519  }
2520 
2521  LOCK2(cs_main, pwallet->cs_wallet);
2522 
2523  // 0 is interpreted by TopUpKeyPool() as the default keypool size given by -keypool
2524  unsigned int kpSize = 0;
2525  if (!request.params[0].isNull()) {
2526  if (request.params[0].get_int() < 0)
2527  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid parameter, expected valid size.");
2528  kpSize = (unsigned int)request.params[0].get_int();
2529  }
2530 
2531  EnsureWalletIsUnlocked(pwallet);
2532  pwallet->TopUpKeyPool(kpSize);
2533 
2534  if (pwallet->GetKeyPoolSize() < kpSize) {
2535  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, "Error refreshing keypool.");
2536  }
2537 
2538  return NullUniValue;
2539 }

2542 static void LockWallet(CWallet* pWallet)
2543 {
2544  LOCK(pWallet->cs_wallet);
2545  pWallet->nRelockTime = 0;
2546  pWallet->Lock();
2547 }
2548 
2549 static UniValue walletpassphrase(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
2550 {
2551  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
2552  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
2553 
2554  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
2555  return NullUniValue;
2556  }
2557 
2558  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() != 2) {
2559  throw std::runtime_error(
2560  "walletpassphrase \"passphrase\" timeout\n"
2561  "\nStores the wallet decryption key in memory for 'timeout' seconds.\n"
2562  "This is needed prior to performing transactions related to private keys such as sending bitcoins\n"
2563  "\nArguments:\n"
2564  "1. \"passphrase\" (string, required) The wallet passphrase\n"
2565  "2. timeout (numeric, required) The time to keep the decryption key in seconds; capped at 100000000 (~3 years).\n"
2566  "\nNote:\n"
2567  "Issuing the walletpassphrase command while the wallet is already unlocked will set a new unlock\n"
2568  "time that overrides the old one.\n"
2569  "\nExamples:\n"
2570  "\nUnlock the wallet for 60 seconds\n"
2571  + HelpExampleCli("walletpassphrase", "\"my pass phrase\" 60") +
2572  "\nLock the wallet again (before 60 seconds)\n"
2573  + HelpExampleCli("walletlock", "") +
2574  "\nAs json rpc call\n"
2575  + HelpExampleRpc("walletpassphrase", "\"my pass phrase\", 60")
2576  );
2577  }
2578 
2579  LOCK2(cs_main, pwallet->cs_wallet);
2580 
2581  if (!pwallet->IsCrypted()) {
2582  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_WRONG_ENC_STATE, "Error: running with an unencrypted wallet, but walletpassphrase was called.");
2583  }
2584 
2585  // Note that the walletpassphrase is stored in request.params[0] which is not mlock()ed
2586  SecureString strWalletPass;
2587  strWalletPass.reserve(100);
2588  // TODO: get rid of this .c_str() by implementing SecureString::operator=(std::string)
2589  // Alternately, find a way to make request.params[0] mlock()'d to begin with.
2590  strWalletPass = request.params[0].get_str().c_str();
2591 
2592  // Get the timeout
2593  int64_t nSleepTime = request.params[1].get_int64();
2594  // Timeout cannot be negative, otherwise it will relock immediately
2595  if (nSleepTime < 0) {
2596  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Timeout cannot be negative.");
2597  }
2598  // Clamp timeout
2599  constexpr int64_t MAX_SLEEP_TIME = 100000000; // larger values trigger a macos/libevent bug?
2600  if (nSleepTime > MAX_SLEEP_TIME) {
2601  nSleepTime = MAX_SLEEP_TIME;
2602  }
2603 
2604  if (strWalletPass.length() > 0)
2605  {
2606  if (!pwallet->Unlock(strWalletPass)) {
2607  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_PASSPHRASE_INCORRECT, "Error: The wallet passphrase entered was incorrect.");
2608  }
2609  }
2610  else
2611  throw std::runtime_error(
2612  "walletpassphrase <passphrase> <timeout>\n"
2613  "Stores the wallet decryption key in memory for <timeout> seconds.");
2614 
2615  pwallet->TopUpKeyPool();
2616 
2617  pwallet->nRelockTime = GetTime() + nSleepTime;
2618  RPCRunLater(strprintf("lockwallet(%s)", pwallet->GetName()), std::bind(LockWallet, pwallet), nSleepTime);
2619 
2620  return NullUniValue;
2621 }
2622

2624 static UniValue walletpassphrasechange(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
2625 {
2626  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
2627  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
2628 
2629  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
2630  return NullUniValue;
2631  }
2632 
2633  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() != 2) {
2634  throw std::runtime_error(
2635  "walletpassphrasechange \"oldpassphrase\" \"newpassphrase\"\n"
2636  "\nChanges the wallet passphrase from 'oldpassphrase' to 'newpassphrase'.\n"
2637  "\nArguments:\n"
2638  "1. \"oldpassphrase\" (string) The current passphrase\n"
2639  "2. \"newpassphrase\" (string) The new passphrase\n"
2640  "\nExamples:\n"
2641  + HelpExampleCli("walletpassphrasechange", "\"old one\" \"new one\"")
2642  + HelpExampleRpc("walletpassphrasechange", "\"old one\", \"new one\"")
2643  );
2644  }
2645 
2646  LOCK2(cs_main, pwallet->cs_wallet);
2647 
2648  if (!pwallet->IsCrypted()) {
2649  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_WRONG_ENC_STATE, "Error: running with an unencrypted wallet, but walletpassphrasechange was called.");
2650  }
2651 
2652  // TODO: get rid of these .c_str() calls by implementing SecureString::operator=(std::string)
2653  // Alternately, find a way to make request.params[0] mlock()'d to begin with.
2654  SecureString strOldWalletPass;
2655  strOldWalletPass.reserve(100);
2656  strOldWalletPass = request.params[0].get_str().c_str();
2657 
2658  SecureString strNewWalletPass;
2659  strNewWalletPass.reserve(100);
2660  strNewWalletPass = request.params[1].get_str().c_str();
2661 
2662  if (strOldWalletPass.length() < 1 || strNewWalletPass.length() < 1)
2663  throw std::runtime_error(
2664  "walletpassphrasechange <oldpassphrase> <newpassphrase>\n"
2665  "Changes the wallet passphrase from <oldpassphrase> to <newpassphrase>.");
2666 
2667  if (!pwallet->ChangeWalletPassphrase(strOldWalletPass, strNewWalletPass)) {
2668  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_PASSPHRASE_INCORRECT, "Error: The wallet passphrase entered was incorrect.");
2669  }
2670 
2671  return NullUniValue;
2672 }

2715 static UniValue encryptwallet(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
2716 {
2717  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
2718  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
2719 
2720  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
2721  return NullUniValue;
2722  }
2723

2725  throw std::runtime_error(
2726  "encryptwallet \"passphrase\"\n"
2727  "\nEncrypts the wallet with 'passphrase'. This is for first time encryption.\n"
2728  "After this, any calls that interact with private keys such as sending or signing \n"
2729  "will require the passphrase to be set prior the making these calls.\n"
2730  "Use the walletpassphrase call for this, and then walletlock call.\n"
2731  "If the wallet is already encrypted, use the walletpassphrasechange call.\n"
2732  "Note that this will shutdown the server.\n"
2733  "\nArguments:\n"
2734  "1. \"passphrase\" (string) The pass phrase to encrypt the wallet with. It must be at least 1 character, but should be long.\n"

2738  "\nNow set the passphrase to use the wallet, such as for signing or sending bitcoin\n"
2739  + HelpExampleCli("walletpassphrase", "\"my pass phrase\"") +
2740  "\nNow we can do something like sign\n"
2741  + HelpExampleCli("signmessage", "\"address\" \"test message\"") +
2742  "\nNow lock the wallet again by removing the passphrase\n"
2743  + HelpExampleCli("walletlock", "") +
2744  "\nAs a json rpc call\n"
2745  + HelpExampleRpc("encryptwallet", "\"my pass phrase\"")
2746  );
2747  }
2748 
2749  LOCK2(cs_main, pwallet->cs_wallet);
2750 
2751  if (pwallet->IsCrypted()) {
2752  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_WRONG_ENC_STATE, "Error: running with an encrypted wallet, but encryptwallet was called.");
2753  }
2754 
2755  // TODO: get rid of this .c_str() by implementing SecureString::operator=(std::string)
2756  // Alternately, find a way to make request.params[0] mlock()'d to begin with.
2757  SecureString strWalletPass;
2758  strWalletPass.reserve(100);
2759  strWalletPass = request.params[0].get_str().c_str();
2760 
2761  if (strWalletPass.length() < 1)
2762  throw std::runtime_error(
2763  "encryptwallet <passphrase>\n"
2764  "Encrypts the wallet with <passphrase>.");
2765 
2766  if (!pwallet->EncryptWallet(strWalletPass)) {
2767  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ENCRYPTION_FAILED, "Error: Failed to encrypt the wallet.");
2768  }
2769 
2770  // BDB seems to have a bad habit of writing old data into
2771  // slack space in .dat files; that is bad if the old data is
2772  // unencrypted private keys. So:
2773  StartShutdown();
2774  return "wallet encrypted; Bitcoin server stopping, restart to run with encrypted wallet. The keypool has been flushed and a new HD seed was generated (if you are using HD). You need to make a new backup.";
2775 }

2777 static UniValue lockunspent(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
2778 {
2779  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
2780  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
2781 
2782  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
2783  return NullUniValue;
2784  }
2785 
2786  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() < 1 || request.params.size() > 2)
2787  throw std::runtime_error(
2788  "lockunspent unlock ([{\"txid\":\"txid\",\"vout\":n},...])\n"
2789  "\nUpdates list of temporarily unspendable outputs.\n"
2790  "Temporarily lock (unlock=false) or unlock (unlock=true) specified transaction outputs.\n"
2791  "If no transaction outputs are specified when unlocking then all current locked transaction outputs are unlocked.\n"
2792  "A locked transaction output will not be chosen by automatic coin selection, when spending bitcoins.\n"
2793  "Locks are stored in memory only. Nodes start with zero locked outputs, and the locked output list\n"
2794  "is always cleared (by virtue of process exit) when a node stops or fails.\n"
2795  "Also see the listunspent call\n"
2796  "\nArguments:\n"
2797  "1. unlock (boolean, required) Whether to unlock (true) or lock (false) the specified transactions\n"
2798  "2. \"transactions\" (string, optional) A json array of objects. Each object the txid (string) vout (numeric)\n"
2799  " [ (json array of json objects)\n"
2800  " {\n"
2801  " \"txid\":\"id\", (string) The transaction id\n"
2802  " \"vout\": n (numeric) The output number\n"
2803  " }\n"
2804  " ,...\n"
2805  " ]\n"
2806 
2807  "\nResult:\n"
2808  "true|false (boolean) Whether the command was successful or not\n"
2809 
2810  "\nExamples:\n"
2811  "\nList the unspent transactions\n"
2812  + HelpExampleCli("listunspent", "") +
2813  "\nLock an unspent transaction\n"
2814  + HelpExampleCli("lockunspent", "false \"[{\\\"txid\\\":\\\"a08e6907dbbd3d809776dbfc5d82e371b764ed838b5655e72f463568df1aadf0\\\",\\\"vout\\\":1}]\"") +
2815  "\nList the locked transactions\n"
2816  + HelpExampleCli("listlockunspent", "") +
2817  "\nUnlock the transaction again\n"
2818  + HelpExampleCli("lockunspent", "true \"[{\\\"txid\\\":\\\"a08e6907dbbd3d809776dbfc5d82e371b764ed838b5655e72f463568df1aadf0\\\",\\\"vout\\\":1}]\"") +
2819  "\nAs a json rpc call\n"
2820  + HelpExampleRpc("lockunspent", "false, \"[{\\\"txid\\\":\\\"a08e6907dbbd3d809776dbfc5d82e371b764ed838b5655e72f463568df1aadf0\\\",\\\"vout\\\":1}]\"")
2821  );
2822 
2823  // Make sure the results are valid at least up to the most recent block
2824  // the user could have gotten from another RPC command prior to now
2825  pwallet->BlockUntilSyncedToCurrentChain();
2826 
2827  LOCK2(cs_main, pwallet->cs_wallet);
2828 
2829  RPCTypeCheckArgument(request.params[0], UniValue::VBOOL);
2830 
2831  bool fUnlock = request.params[0].get_bool();
2832 
2833  if (request.params[1].isNull()) {
2834  if (fUnlock)
2835  pwallet->UnlockAllCoins();
2836  return true;
2837  }
2838 
2839  RPCTypeCheckArgument(request.params[1], UniValue::VARR);
2840 
2841  const UniValue& output_params = request.params[1];
2842 
2843  // Create and validate the COutPoints first.
2844 
2845  std::vector<COutPoint> outputs;
2846  outputs.reserve(output_params.size());
2847 
2848  for (unsigned int idx = 0; idx < output_params.size(); idx++) {
2849  const UniValue& o = output_params[idx].get_obj();
2850 
2851  RPCTypeCheckObj(o,
2852  {
2853  {"txid", UniValueType(UniValue::VSTR)},
2854  {"vout", UniValueType(UniValue::VNUM)},
2855  });
2856 
2857  const std::string& txid = find_value(o, "txid").get_str();
2858  if (!IsHex(txid)) {
2859  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid parameter, expected hex txid");
2860  }
2861 
2862  const int nOutput = find_value(o, "vout").get_int();
2863  if (nOutput < 0) {
2864  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid parameter, vout must be positive");
2865  }
2866 
2867  const COutPoint outpt(uint256S(txid), nOutput);
2868 
2869  const auto it = pwallet->mapWallet.find(outpt.hash);
2870  if (it == pwallet->mapWallet.end()) {
2871  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid parameter, unknown transaction");
2872  }
2873 
2874  const CWalletTx& trans = it->second;
2875 
2876  if (outpt.n >= trans.tx->vout.size()) {
2877  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid parameter, vout index out of bounds");
2878  }
2879 
2880  if (pwallet->IsSpent(outpt.hash, outpt.n)) {
2881  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid parameter, expected unspent output");
2882  }
2883 
2884  const bool is_locked = pwallet->IsLockedCoin(outpt.hash, outpt.n);
2885 
2886  if (fUnlock && !is_locked) {
2887  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid parameter, expected locked output");
2888  }
2889 
2890  if (!fUnlock && is_locked) {
2891  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid parameter, output already locked");
2892  }
2893 
2894  outputs.push_back(outpt);
2895  }
2896 
2897  // Atomically set (un)locked status for the outputs.
2898  for (const COutPoint& outpt : outputs) {
2899  if (fUnlock) pwallet->UnlockCoin(outpt);
2900  else pwallet->LockCoin(outpt);
2901  }
2902 
2903  return true;
2904 }

2952  o.pushKV("vout", (int)outpt.n);
2953  ret.push_back(o);
2954  }
2955 
2956  return ret;
2957 }

3091 {

3093  throw std::runtime_error(
3094  "loadwallet \"filename\"\n"

3096  "\nNote that all wallet command-line options used when starting bitcoind will be"

3107  + HelpExampleRpc("loadwallet", "\"test.dat\"")
3108  );

3110  std::string error;
3111 
3112  fs::path wallet_path = fs::absolute(wallet_file, GetWalletDir());
3113  if (fs::symlink_status(wallet_path).type() == fs::file_not_found) {
3114  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_NOT_FOUND, "Wallet " + wallet_file + " not found.");
3115  } else if (fs::is_directory(wallet_path)) {
3116  // The given filename is a directory. Check that there's a wallet.dat file.
3117  fs::path wallet_dat_file = wallet_path / "wallet.dat";
3118  if (fs::symlink_status(wallet_dat_file).type() == fs::file_not_found) {
3119  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_NOT_FOUND, "Directory " + wallet_file + " does not contain a wallet.dat file.");
3120  }
3121  }
3122 
3123  std::string warning;
3124  if (!CWallet::Verify(wallet_file, false, error, warning)) {
3125  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, "Wallet file verification failed: " + error);
3126  }
3127 
3128  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = CWallet::CreateWalletFromFile(wallet_file, fs::absolute(wallet_file, GetWalletDir()));
3129  if (!wallet) {
3130  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, "Wallet loading failed.");
3131  }
3132  AddWallet(wallet);
3133 
3134  wallet->postInitProcess();
3135 
3136  UniValue obj(UniValue::VOBJ);
3137  obj.pushKV("name", wallet->GetName());
3138  obj.pushKV("warning", warning);
3139 
3140  return obj;
3141 }

3182  if (!wallet) {

3184  }

3186

3188

3191  obj.pushKV("warning", warning);

3196 static UniValue unloadwallet(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
3197 {
3198  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() > 1) {
3199  throw std::runtime_error(
3200  "unloadwallet ( \"wallet_name\" )\n"
3201  "Unloads the wallet referenced by the request endpoint otherwise unloads the wallet specified in the argument.\n"
3202  "Specifying the wallet name on a wallet endpoint is invalid."
3203  "\nArguments:\n"
3204  "1. \"wallet_name\" (string, optional) The name of the wallet to unload.\n"
3205  "\nExamples:\n"
3206  + HelpExampleCli("unloadwallet", "wallet_name")
3207  + HelpExampleRpc("unloadwallet", "wallet_name")
3208  );
3209  }
3210 
3211  std::string wallet_name;
3212  if (GetWalletNameFromJSONRPCRequest(request, wallet_name)) {
3213  if (!request.params[0].isNull()) {
3214  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Cannot unload the requested wallet");
3215  }
3216  } else {
3217  wallet_name = request.params[0].get_str();
3218  }
3219 
3220  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> wallet = GetWallet(wallet_name);
3221  if (!wallet) {
3222  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_NOT_FOUND, "Requested wallet does not exist or is not loaded");
3223  }
3224 
3225  // Release the "main" shared pointer and prevent further notifications.
3226  // Note that any attempt to load the same wallet would fail until the wallet
3227  // is destroyed (see CheckUniqueFileid).
3228  if (!RemoveWallet(wallet)) {
3229  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_MISC_ERROR, "Requested wallet already unloaded");
3230  }
3231  UnregisterValidationInterface(wallet.get());
3232 
3233  // The wallet can be in use so it's not possible to explicitly unload here.
3234  // Just notify the unload intent so that all shared pointers are released.
3235  // The wallet will be destroyed once the last shared pointer is released.
3236  wallet->NotifyUnload();
3237 
3238  // There's no point in waiting for the wallet to unload.
3239  // At this point this method should never fail. The unloading could only
3240  // fail due to an unexpected error which would cause a process termination.
3241 
3242  return NullUniValue;
3243 }

3341  );
3342 
3343  int nMinDepth = 1;
3344  if (!request.params[0].isNull()) {
3345  RPCTypeCheckArgument(request.params[0], UniValue::VNUM);
3346  nMinDepth = request.params[0].get_int();
3347  }
3348 
3349  int nMaxDepth = 9999999;
3350  if (!request.params[1].isNull()) {
3351  RPCTypeCheckArgument(request.params[1], UniValue::VNUM);
3352  nMaxDepth = request.params[1].get_int();
3353  }
3354 
3355  std::set<CTxDestination> destinations;
3356  if (!request.params[2].isNull()) {
3357  RPCTypeCheckArgument(request.params[2], UniValue::VARR);
3358  UniValue inputs = request.params[2].get_array();
3359  for (unsigned int idx = 0; idx < inputs.size(); idx++) {
3360  const UniValue& input = inputs[idx];
3361  CTxDestination dest = DecodeDestination(input.get_str());
3362  if (!IsValidDestination(dest)) {
3363  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY, std::string("Invalid Bitcoin address: ") + input.get_str());
3364  }
3365  if (!destinations.insert(dest).second) {
3366  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, std::string("Invalid parameter, duplicated address: ") + input.get_str());
3367  }
3368  }
3369  }
3370 
3371  bool include_unsafe = true;
3372  if (!request.params[3].isNull()) {
3373  RPCTypeCheckArgument(request.params[3], UniValue::VBOOL);
3374  include_unsafe = request.params[3].get_bool();
3375  }
3376 
3377  CAmount nMinimumAmount = 0;
3378  CAmount nMaximumAmount = MAX_MONEY;
3379  CAmount nMinimumSumAmount = MAX_MONEY;
3380  uint64_t nMaximumCount = 0;
3381 
3382  if (!request.params[4].isNull()) {
3383  const UniValue& options = request.params[4].get_obj();
3384 
3385  if (options.exists("minimumAmount"))
3386  nMinimumAmount = AmountFromValue(options["minimumAmount"]);
3387 
3388  if (options.exists("maximumAmount"))
3389  nMaximumAmount = AmountFromValue(options["maximumAmount"]);
3390 
3391  if (options.exists("minimumSumAmount"))
3392  nMinimumSumAmount = AmountFromValue(options["minimumSumAmount"]);
3393 
3394  if (options.exists("maximumCount"))
3395  nMaximumCount = options["maximumCount"].get_int64();
3396  }
3397 
3398  // Make sure the results are valid at least up to the most recent block
3399  // the user could have gotten from another RPC command prior to now
3400  pwallet->BlockUntilSyncedToCurrentChain();
3401 
3402  UniValue results(UniValue::VARR);
3403  std::vector<COutput> vecOutputs;
3404  {
3405  LOCK2(cs_main, pwallet->cs_wallet);
3406  pwallet->AvailableCoins(vecOutputs, !include_unsafe, nullptr, nMinimumAmount, nMaximumAmount, nMinimumSumAmount, nMaximumCount, nMinDepth, nMaxDepth);
3407  }
3408 
3409  LOCK(pwallet->cs_wallet);
3410 
3411  for (const COutput& out : vecOutputs) {
3412  CTxDestination address;
3413  const CScript& scriptPubKey = out.tx->tx->vout[out.i].scriptPubKey;
3414  bool fValidAddress = ExtractDestination(scriptPubKey, address);
3415 
3416  if (destinations.size() && (!fValidAddress || !destinations.count(address)))
3417  continue;
3418 
3419  UniValue entry(UniValue::VOBJ);
3420  entry.pushKV("txid", out.tx->GetHash().GetHex());
3421  entry.pushKV("vout", out.i);
3422 
3423  if (fValidAddress) {
3424  entry.pushKV("address", EncodeDestination(address));
3425 
3426  auto i = pwallet->mapAddressBook.find(address);
3427  if (i != pwallet->mapAddressBook.end()) {
3428  entry.pushKV("label", i->second.name);
3429  if (IsDeprecatedRPCEnabled("accounts")) {
3430  entry.pushKV("account", i->second.name);
3431  }
3432  }
3433 
3434  if (scriptPubKey.IsPayToScriptHash()) {
3435  const CScriptID& hash = boost::get<CScriptID>(address);
3436  CScript redeemScript;
3437  if (pwallet->GetCScript(hash, redeemScript)) {
3438  entry.pushKV("redeemScript", HexStr(redeemScript.begin(), redeemScript.end()));
3439  }
3440  }
3441  }
3442 
3443  entry.pushKV("scriptPubKey", HexStr(scriptPubKey.begin(), scriptPubKey.end()));
3444  entry.pushKV("amount", ValueFromAmount(out.tx->tx->vout[out.i].nValue));
3445  entry.pushKV("confirmations", out.nDepth);
3446  entry.pushKV("spendable", out.fSpendable);
3447  entry.pushKV("solvable", out.fSolvable);
3448  entry.pushKV("safe", out.fSafe);
3449  results.push_back(entry);
3450  }
3451 
3452  return results;
3453 }

3455 void FundTransaction(CWallet* const pwallet, CMutableTransaction& tx, CAmount& fee_out, int& change_position, UniValue options)
3456 {
3457  // Make sure the results are valid at least up to the most recent block
3458  // the user could have gotten from another RPC command prior to now
3459  pwallet->BlockUntilSyncedToCurrentChain();
3460 
3461  CCoinControl coinControl;
3462  change_position = -1;
3463  bool lockUnspents = false;
3464  UniValue subtractFeeFromOutputs;
3465  std::set<int> setSubtractFeeFromOutputs;
3466 
3467  if (!options.isNull()) {
3468  if (options.type() == UniValue::VBOOL) {
3469  // backward compatibility bool only fallback
3470  coinControl.fAllowWatchOnly = options.get_bool();
3471  }
3472  else {
3473  RPCTypeCheckArgument(options, UniValue::VOBJ);
3474  RPCTypeCheckObj(options,
3475  {
3476  {"changeAddress", UniValueType(UniValue::VSTR)},
3477  {"changePosition", UniValueType(UniValue::VNUM)},
3478  {"change_type", UniValueType(UniValue::VSTR)},
3479  {"includeWatching", UniValueType(UniValue::VBOOL)},
3480  {"lockUnspents", UniValueType(UniValue::VBOOL)},
3481  {"feeRate", UniValueType()}, // will be checked below
3482  {"subtractFeeFromOutputs", UniValueType(UniValue::VARR)},
3483  {"replaceable", UniValueType(UniValue::VBOOL)},
3484  {"conf_target", UniValueType(UniValue::VNUM)},
3485  {"estimate_mode", UniValueType(UniValue::VSTR)},
3486  },
3487  true, true);
3488 
3489  if (options.exists("changeAddress")) {
3490  CTxDestination dest = DecodeDestination(options["changeAddress"].get_str());
3491 
3492  if (!IsValidDestination(dest)) {
3493  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY, "changeAddress must be a valid bitcoin address");
3494  }
3495 
3496  coinControl.destChange = dest;
3497  }
3498 
3499  if (options.exists("changePosition"))
3500  change_position = options["changePosition"].get_int();
3501 
3502  if (options.exists("change_type")) {
3503  if (options.exists("changeAddress")) {
3504  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Cannot specify both changeAddress and address_type options");
3505  }
3506  coinControl.m_change_type = pwallet->m_default_change_type;
3507  if (!ParseOutputType(options["change_type"].get_str(), *coinControl.m_change_type)) {
3508  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY, strprintf("Unknown change type '%s'", options["change_type"].get_str()));
3509  }
3510  }
3511 
3512  if (options.exists("includeWatching"))
3513  coinControl.fAllowWatchOnly = options["includeWatching"].get_bool();
3514 
3515  if (options.exists("lockUnspents"))
3516  lockUnspents = options["lockUnspents"].get_bool();
3517 
3518  if (options.exists("feeRate"))
3519  {
3520  coinControl.m_feerate = CFeeRate(AmountFromValue(options["feeRate"]));
3521  coinControl.fOverrideFeeRate = true;
3522  }
3523 
3524  if (options.exists("subtractFeeFromOutputs"))
3525  subtractFeeFromOutputs = options["subtractFeeFromOutputs"].get_array();
3526 
3527  if (options.exists("replaceable")) {
3528  coinControl.m_signal_bip125_rbf = options["replaceable"].get_bool();
3529  }
3530  if (options.exists("conf_target")) {
3531  if (options.exists("feeRate")) {
3532  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Cannot specify both conf_target and feeRate");
3533  }
3534  coinControl.m_confirm_target = ParseConfirmTarget(options["conf_target"]);
3535  }
3536  if (options.exists("estimate_mode")) {
3537  if (options.exists("feeRate")) {
3538  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Cannot specify both estimate_mode and feeRate");
3539  }
3540  if (!FeeModeFromString(options["estimate_mode"].get_str(), coinControl.m_fee_mode)) {
3541  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid estimate_mode parameter");
3542  }
3543  }
3544  }
3545  }
3546 
3547  if (tx.vout.size() == 0)
3548  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "TX must have at least one output");
3549 
3550  if (change_position != -1 && (change_position < 0 || (unsigned int)change_position > tx.vout.size()))
3551  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "changePosition out of bounds");
3552 
3553  for (unsigned int idx = 0; idx < subtractFeeFromOutputs.size(); idx++) {
3554  int pos = subtractFeeFromOutputs[idx].get_int();
3555  if (setSubtractFeeFromOutputs.count(pos))
3556  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, strprintf("Invalid parameter, duplicated position: %d", pos));
3557  if (pos < 0)
3558  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, strprintf("Invalid parameter, negative position: %d", pos));
3559  if (pos >= int(tx.vout.size()))
3560  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, strprintf("Invalid parameter, position too large: %d", pos));
3561  setSubtractFeeFromOutputs.insert(pos);
3562  }
3563 
3564  std::string strFailReason;
3565 
3566  if (!pwallet->FundTransaction(tx, fee_out, change_position, strFailReason, lockUnspents, setSubtractFeeFromOutputs, coinControl)) {
3567  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, strFailReason);
3568  }
3569 }
3570 
3571 static UniValue fundrawtransaction(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
3572 {
3573  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
3574  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
3575 
3576  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
3577  return NullUniValue;
3578  }
3579 
3580  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() < 1 || request.params.size() > 3)
3581  throw std::runtime_error(
3582  "fundrawtransaction \"hexstring\" ( options iswitness )\n"
3583  "\nAdd inputs to a transaction until it has enough in value to meet its out value.\n"
3584  "This will not modify existing inputs, and will add at most one change output to the outputs.\n"
3585  "No existing outputs will be modified unless \"subtractFeeFromOutputs\" is specified.\n"
3586  "Note that inputs which were signed may need to be resigned after completion since in/outputs have been added.\n"
3587  "The inputs added will not be signed, use signrawtransaction for that.\n"
3588  "Note that all existing inputs must have their previous output transaction be in the wallet.\n"
3589  "Note that all inputs selected must be of standard form and P2SH scripts must be\n"
3590  "in the wallet using importaddress or addmultisigaddress (to calculate fees).\n"
3591  "You can see whether this is the case by checking the \"solvable\" field in the listunspent output.\n"
3592  "Only pay-to-pubkey, multisig, and P2SH versions thereof are currently supported for watch-only\n"
3593  "\nArguments:\n"
3594  "1. \"hexstring\" (string, required) The hex string of the raw transaction\n"
3595  "2. options (object, optional)\n"
3596  " {\n"
3597  " \"changeAddress\" (string, optional, default pool address) The bitcoin address to receive the change\n"
3598  " \"changePosition\" (numeric, optional, default random) The index of the change output\n"
3599  " \"change_type\" (string, optional) The output type to use. Only valid if changeAddress is not specified. Options are \"legacy\", \"p2sh-segwit\", and \"bech32\". Default is set by -changetype.\n"
3600  " \"includeWatching\" (boolean, optional, default false) Also select inputs which are watch only\n"
3601  " \"lockUnspents\" (boolean, optional, default false) Lock selected unspent outputs\n"
3602  " \"feeRate\" (numeric, optional, default not set: makes wallet determine the fee) Set a specific fee rate in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "/kB\n"
3603  " \"subtractFeeFromOutputs\" (array, optional) A json array of integers.\n"
3604  " The fee will be equally deducted from the amount of each specified output.\n"
3605  " The outputs are specified by their zero-based index, before any change output is added.\n"
3606  " Those recipients will receive less bitcoins than you enter in their corresponding amount field.\n"
3607  " If no outputs are specified here, the sender pays the fee.\n"
3608  " [vout_index,...]\n"
3609  " \"replaceable\" (boolean, optional) Marks this transaction as BIP125 replaceable.\n"
3610  " Allows this transaction to be replaced by a transaction with higher fees\n"
3611  " \"conf_target\" (numeric, optional) Confirmation target (in blocks)\n"
3612  " \"estimate_mode\" (string, optional, default=UNSET) The fee estimate mode, must be one of:\n"
3613  " \"UNSET\"\n"
3614  " \"ECONOMICAL\"\n"
3615  " \"CONSERVATIVE\"\n"
3616  " }\n"
3617  " for backward compatibility: passing in a true instead of an object will result in {\"includeWatching\":true}\n"
3618  "3. iswitness (boolean, optional) Whether the transaction hex is a serialized witness transaction \n"
3619  " If iswitness is not present, heuristic tests will be used in decoding\n"
3620 
3621  "\nResult:\n"
3622  "{\n"
3623  " \"hex\": \"value\", (string) The resulting raw transaction (hex-encoded string)\n"
3624  " \"fee\": n, (numeric) Fee in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + " the resulting transaction pays\n"
3625  " \"changepos\": n (numeric) The position of the added change output, or -1\n"
3626  "}\n"
3627  "\nExamples:\n"
3628  "\nCreate a transaction with no inputs\n"
3629  + HelpExampleCli("createrawtransaction", "\"[]\" \"{\\\"myaddress\\\":0.01}\"") +
3630  "\nAdd sufficient unsigned inputs to meet the output value\n"
3631  + HelpExampleCli("fundrawtransaction", "\"rawtransactionhex\"") +
3632  "\nSign the transaction\n"
3633  + HelpExampleCli("signrawtransaction", "\"fundedtransactionhex\"") +
3634  "\nSend the transaction\n"
3635  + HelpExampleCli("sendrawtransaction", "\"signedtransactionhex\"")
3636  );
3637 
3638  RPCTypeCheck(request.params, {UniValue::VSTR, UniValueType(), UniValue::VBOOL});
3639 
3640  // parse hex string from parameter
3641  CMutableTransaction tx;
3642  bool try_witness = request.params[2].isNull() ? true : request.params[2].get_bool();
3643  bool try_no_witness = request.params[2].isNull() ? true : !request.params[2].get_bool();
3644  if (!DecodeHexTx(tx, request.params[0].get_str(), try_no_witness, try_witness)) {
3645  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_DESERIALIZATION_ERROR, "TX decode failed");
3646  }
3647 
3648  CAmount fee;
3649  int change_position;
3650  FundTransaction(pwallet, tx, fee, change_position, request.params[1]);
3651 
3652  UniValue result(UniValue::VOBJ);
3653  result.pushKV("hex", EncodeHexTx(tx));
3654  result.pushKV("fee", ValueFromAmount(fee));
3655  result.pushKV("changepos", change_position);
3656 
3657  return result;
3658 }

3660 UniValue signrawtransactionwithwallet(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
3661 {
3662  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
3663  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
3664 
3665  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
3666  return NullUniValue;
3667  }
3668 
3669  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() < 1 || request.params.size() > 3)
3670  throw std::runtime_error(
3671  "signrawtransactionwithwallet \"hexstring\" ( [{\"txid\":\"id\",\"vout\":n,\"scriptPubKey\":\"hex\",\"redeemScript\":\"hex\"},...] sighashtype )\n"

3673  "The second optional argument (may be null) is an array of previous transaction outputs that\n"

3676

3683  " \"vout\":n, (numeric, required) The output number\n"

3685  " \"redeemScript\": \"hex\", (string, required for P2SH or P2WSH) redeem script\n"

3687  " }\n"
3688  " ,...\n"

3693  " \"SINGLE\"\n"
3694  " \"ALL|ANYONECANPAY\"\n"
3695  " \"NONE|ANYONECANPAY\"\n"
3696  " \"SINGLE|ANYONECANPAY\"\n"
3697 
3698  "\nResult:\n"
3699  "{\n"
3700  " \"hex\" : \"value\", (string) The hex-encoded raw transaction with signature(s)\n"
3701  " \"complete\" : true|false, (boolean) If the transaction has a complete set of signatures\n"
3702  " \"errors\" : [ (json array of objects) Script verification errors (if there are any)\n"
3703  " {\n"
3704  " \"txid\" : \"hash\", (string) The hash of the referenced, previous transaction\n"
3705  " \"vout\" : n, (numeric) The index of the output to spent and used as input\n"
3706  " \"scriptSig\" : \"hex\", (string) The hex-encoded signature script\n"
3707  " \"sequence\" : n, (numeric) Script sequence number\n"
3708  " \"error\" : \"text\" (string) Verification or signing error related to the input\n"
3709  " }\n"
3710  " ,...\n"
3711  " ]\n"
3712  "}\n"
3713 
3714  "\nExamples:\n"
3715  + HelpExampleCli("signrawtransactionwithwallet", "\"myhex\"")
3716  + HelpExampleRpc("signrawtransactionwithwallet", "\"myhex\"")
3717  );
3718 
3719  RPCTypeCheck(request.params, {UniValue::VSTR, UniValue::VARR, UniValue::VSTR}, true);
3720 
3721  CMutableTransaction mtx;
3722  if (!DecodeHexTx(mtx, request.params[0].get_str(), true)) {
3723  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_DESERIALIZATION_ERROR, "TX decode failed");
3724  }
3725 
3726  // Sign the transaction
3727  LOCK2(cs_main, pwallet->cs_wallet);
3728  return SignTransaction(mtx, request.params[1], pwallet, false, request.params[2]);
3729 }

3731 static UniValue bumpfee(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
3732 {
3733  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
3734  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
3735 
3736 
3737  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp))
3738  return NullUniValue;
3739 
3740  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() < 1 || request.params.size() > 2) {
3741  throw std::runtime_error(
3742  "bumpfee \"txid\" ( options ) \n"
3743  "\nBumps the fee of an opt-in-RBF transaction T, replacing it with a new transaction B.\n"
3744  "An opt-in RBF transaction with the given txid must be in the wallet.\n"
3745  "The command will pay the additional fee by decreasing (or perhaps removing) its change output.\n"
3746  "If the change output is not big enough to cover the increased fee, the command will currently fail\n"
3747  "instead of adding new inputs to compensate. (A future implementation could improve this.)\n"
3748  "The command will fail if the wallet or mempool contains a transaction that spends one of T's outputs.\n"
3749  "By default, the new fee will be calculated automatically using estimatesmartfee.\n"
3750  "The user can specify a confirmation target for estimatesmartfee.\n"
3751  "Alternatively, the user can specify totalFee, or use RPC settxfee to set a higher fee rate.\n"
3752  "At a minimum, the new fee rate must be high enough to pay an additional new relay fee (incrementalfee\n"
3753  "returned by getnetworkinfo) to enter the node's mempool.\n"
3754  "\nArguments:\n"
3755  "1. txid (string, required) The txid to be bumped\n"
3756  "2. options (object, optional)\n"
3757  " {\n"
3758  " \"confTarget\" (numeric, optional) Confirmation target (in blocks)\n"
3759  " \"totalFee\" (numeric, optional) Total fee (NOT feerate) to pay, in satoshis.\n"
3760  " In rare cases, the actual fee paid might be slightly higher than the specified\n"
3761  " totalFee if the tx change output has to be removed because it is too close to\n"
3762  " the dust threshold.\n"
3763  " \"replaceable\" (boolean, optional, default true) Whether the new transaction should still be\n"
3764  " marked bip-125 replaceable. If true, the sequence numbers in the transaction will\n"
3765  " be left unchanged from the original. If false, any input sequence numbers in the\n"
3766  " original transaction that were less than 0xfffffffe will be increased to 0xfffffffe\n"
3767  " so the new transaction will not be explicitly bip-125 replaceable (though it may\n"
3768  " still be replaceable in practice, for example if it has unconfirmed ancestors which\n"
3769  " are replaceable).\n"
3770  " \"estimate_mode\" (string, optional, default=UNSET) The fee estimate mode, must be one of:\n"
3771  " \"UNSET\"\n"
3772  " \"ECONOMICAL\"\n"
3773  " \"CONSERVATIVE\"\n"
3774  " }\n"
3775  "\nResult:\n"
3776  "{\n"
3777  " \"txid\": \"value\", (string) The id of the new transaction\n"
3778  " \"origfee\": n, (numeric) Fee of the replaced transaction\n"
3779  " \"fee\": n, (numeric) Fee of the new transaction\n"
3780  " \"errors\": [ str... ] (json array of strings) Errors encountered during processing (may be empty)\n"
3781  "}\n"
3782  "\nExamples:\n"
3783  "\nBump the fee, get the new transaction\'s txid\n" +
3784  HelpExampleCli("bumpfee", "<txid>"));
3785  }
3786 
3787  RPCTypeCheck(request.params, {UniValue::VSTR, UniValue::VOBJ});
3788  uint256 hash;
3789  hash.SetHex(request.params[0].get_str());
3790 
3791  // optional parameters
3792  CAmount totalFee = 0;
3793  CCoinControl coin_control;
3794  coin_control.m_signal_bip125_rbf = true;
3795  if (!request.params[1].isNull()) {
3796  UniValue options = request.params[1];
3797  RPCTypeCheckObj(options,
3798  {
3799  {"confTarget", UniValueType(UniValue::VNUM)},
3800  {"totalFee", UniValueType(UniValue::VNUM)},
3801  {"replaceable", UniValueType(UniValue::VBOOL)},
3802  {"estimate_mode", UniValueType(UniValue::VSTR)},
3803  },
3804  true, true);
3805 
3806  if (options.exists("confTarget") && options.exists("totalFee")) {
3807  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "confTarget and totalFee options should not both be set. Please provide either a confirmation target for fee estimation or an explicit total fee for the transaction.");
3808  } else if (options.exists("confTarget")) { // TODO: alias this to conf_target
3809  coin_control.m_confirm_target = ParseConfirmTarget(options["confTarget"]);
3810  } else if (options.exists("totalFee")) {
3811  totalFee = options["totalFee"].get_int64();
3812  if (totalFee <= 0) {
3813  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, strprintf("Invalid totalFee %s (must be greater than 0)", FormatMoney(totalFee)));
3814  }
3815  }
3816 
3817  if (options.exists("replaceable")) {
3818  coin_control.m_signal_bip125_rbf = options["replaceable"].get_bool();
3819  }
3820  if (options.exists("estimate_mode")) {
3821  if (!FeeModeFromString(options["estimate_mode"].get_str(), coin_control.m_fee_mode)) {
3822  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid estimate_mode parameter");
3823  }
3824  }
3825  }
3826 
3827  // Make sure the results are valid at least up to the most recent block
3828  // the user could have gotten from another RPC command prior to now
3829  pwallet->BlockUntilSyncedToCurrentChain();
3830 
3831  LOCK2(cs_main, pwallet->cs_wallet);
3832  EnsureWalletIsUnlocked(pwallet);
3833 
3834 
3835  std::vector<std::string> errors;
3836  CAmount old_fee;
3837  CAmount new_fee;
3838  CMutableTransaction mtx;
3839  feebumper::Result res = feebumper::CreateTransaction(pwallet, hash, coin_control, totalFee, errors, old_fee, new_fee, mtx);
3840  if (res != feebumper::Result::OK) {
3841  switch(res) {
3842  case feebumper::Result::INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY:
3843  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY, errors[0]);
3844  break;
3845  case feebumper::Result::INVALID_REQUEST:
3846  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_REQUEST, errors[0]);
3847  break;
3848  case feebumper::Result::INVALID_PARAMETER:
3849  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, errors[0]);
3850  break;
3851  case feebumper::Result::WALLET_ERROR:
3852  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, errors[0]);
3853  break;
3854  default:
3855  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_MISC_ERROR, errors[0]);
3856  break;
3857  }
3858  }
3859 
3860  // sign bumped transaction
3861  if (!feebumper::SignTransaction(pwallet, mtx)) {
3862  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, "Can't sign transaction.");
3863  }
3864  // commit the bumped transaction
3865  uint256 txid;
3866  if (feebumper::CommitTransaction(pwallet, hash, std::move(mtx), errors, txid) != feebumper::Result::OK) {
3867  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, errors[0]);
3868  }
3869  UniValue result(UniValue::VOBJ);
3870  result.pushKV("txid", txid.GetHex());
3871  result.pushKV("origfee", ValueFromAmount(old_fee));
3872  result.pushKV("fee", ValueFromAmount(new_fee));
3873  UniValue result_errors(UniValue::VARR);
3874  for (const std::string& error : errors) {
3875  result_errors.push_back(error);
3876  }
3877  result.pushKV("errors", result_errors);
3878 
3879  return result;
3880 }
3881 
3882 UniValue generate(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
3883 {
3884  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
3885  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
3886 
3887 
3888  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
3889  return NullUniValue;
3890  }
3891 
3892  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() < 1 || request.params.size() > 2) {
3893  throw std::runtime_error(
3894  "generate nblocks ( maxtries )\n"
3895  "\nMine up to nblocks blocks immediately (before the RPC call returns) to an address in the wallet.\n"
3896  "\nArguments:\n"
3897  "1. nblocks (numeric, required) How many blocks are generated immediately.\n"
3898  "2. maxtries (numeric, optional) How many iterations to try (default = 1000000).\n"
3899  "\nResult:\n"
3900  "[ blockhashes ] (array) hashes of blocks generated\n"
3901  "\nExamples:\n"
3902  "\nGenerate 11 blocks\n"
3903  + HelpExampleCli("generate", "11")
3904  );
3905  }
3906 
3907  int num_generate = request.params[0].get_int();
3908  uint64_t max_tries = 1000000;
3909  if (!request.params[1].isNull()) {
3910  max_tries = request.params[1].get_int();
3911  }
3912 
3913  std::shared_ptr<CReserveScript> coinbase_script;
3914  pwallet->GetScriptForMining(coinbase_script);
3915 
3916  // If the keypool is exhausted, no script is returned at all. Catch this.
3917  if (!coinbase_script) {
3918  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_KEYPOOL_RAN_OUT, "Error: Keypool ran out, please call keypoolrefill first");
3919  }
3920 
3921  //throw an error if no script was provided
3922  if (coinbase_script->reserveScript.empty()) {
3923  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INTERNAL_ERROR, "No coinbase script available");
3924  }
3925 
3926  return generateBlocks(coinbase_script, num_generate, max_tries, true);
3927 }

3929 UniValue rescanblockchain(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
3930 {
3931  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
3932  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
3933 
3934  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
3935  return NullUniValue;
3936  }
3937 
3938  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() > 2) {
3939  throw std::runtime_error(
3940  "rescanblockchain (\"start_height\") (\"stop_height\")\n"
3941  "\nRescan the local blockchain for wallet related transactions.\n"
3942  "\nArguments:\n"
3943  "1. \"start_height\" (numeric, optional) block height where the rescan should start\n"
3944  "2. \"stop_height\" (numeric, optional) the last block height that should be scanned\n"
3945  "\nResult:\n"
3946  "{\n"
3947  " \"start_height\" (numeric) The block height where the rescan has started. If omitted, rescan started from the genesis block.\n"
3948  " \"stop_height\" (numeric) The height of the last rescanned block. If omitted, rescan stopped at the chain tip.\n"
3949  "}\n"
3950  "\nExamples:\n"
3951  + HelpExampleCli("rescanblockchain", "100000 120000")
3952  + HelpExampleRpc("rescanblockchain", "100000, 120000")
3953  );
3954  }
3955 
3956  WalletRescanReserver reserver(pwallet);
3957  if (!reserver.reserve()) {
3958  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, "Wallet is currently rescanning. Abort existing rescan or wait.");
3959  }
3960 
3961  CBlockIndex *pindexStart = nullptr;
3962  CBlockIndex *pindexStop = nullptr;
3963  CBlockIndex *pChainTip = nullptr;
3964  {
3965  LOCK(cs_main);
3966  pindexStart = chainActive.Genesis();
3967  pChainTip = chainActive.Tip();
3968 
3969  if (!request.params[0].isNull()) {
3970  pindexStart = chainActive[request.params[0].get_int()];
3971  if (!pindexStart) {
3972  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid start_height");
3973  }
3974  }
3975 
3976  if (!request.params[1].isNull()) {
3977  pindexStop = chainActive[request.params[1].get_int()];
3978  if (!pindexStop) {
3979  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "Invalid stop_height");
3980  }
3981  else if (pindexStop->nHeight < pindexStart->nHeight) {
3982  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER, "stop_height must be greater than start_height");
3983  }
3984  }
3985  }
3986 
3987  // We can't rescan beyond non-pruned blocks, stop and throw an error
3988  if (fPruneMode) {
3989  LOCK(cs_main);
3990  CBlockIndex *block = pindexStop ? pindexStop : pChainTip;
3991  while (block && block->nHeight >= pindexStart->nHeight) {
3992  if (!(block->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA)) {
3993  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_MISC_ERROR, "Can't rescan beyond pruned data. Use RPC call getblockchaininfo to determine your pruned height.");
3994  }
3995  block = block->pprev;
3996  }
3997  }
3998 
3999  CBlockIndex *stopBlock = pwallet->ScanForWalletTransactions(pindexStart, pindexStop, reserver, true);
4000  if (!stopBlock) {
4001  if (pwallet->IsAbortingRescan()) {
4002  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_MISC_ERROR, "Rescan aborted.");
4003  }
4004  // if we got a nullptr returned, ScanForWalletTransactions did rescan up to the requested stopindex
4005  stopBlock = pindexStop ? pindexStop : pChainTip;
4006  }
4007  else {
4008  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_MISC_ERROR, "Rescan failed. Potentially corrupted data files.");
4009  }
4010  UniValue response(UniValue::VOBJ);
4011  response.pushKV("start_height", pindexStart->nHeight);
4012  response.pushKV("stop_height", stopBlock->nHeight);
4013  return response;
4014 }
4015 
4016 class DescribeWalletAddressVisitor : public boost::static_visitor<UniValue>
4017 {
4018 public:
4019  CWallet * const pwallet;
4020 
4021  void ProcessSubScript(const CScript& subscript, UniValue& obj, bool include_addresses = false) const
4022  {
4023  // Always present: script type and redeemscript
4024  txnouttype which_type;
4025  std::vector<std::vector<unsigned char>> solutions_data;
4026  Solver(subscript, which_type, solutions_data);
4027  obj.pushKV("script", GetTxnOutputType(which_type));
4028  obj.pushKV("hex", HexStr(subscript.begin(), subscript.end()));
4029 
4030  CTxDestination embedded;
4031  UniValue a(UniValue::VARR);
4032  if (ExtractDestination(subscript, embedded)) {
4033  // Only when the script corresponds to an address.
4034  UniValue subobj(UniValue::VOBJ);
4035  UniValue detail = DescribeAddress(embedded);
4036  subobj.pushKVs(detail);
4037  UniValue wallet_detail = boost::apply_visitor(*this, embedded);
4038  subobj.pushKVs(wallet_detail);
4039  subobj.pushKV("address", EncodeDestination(embedded));
4040  subobj.pushKV("scriptPubKey", HexStr(subscript.begin(), subscript.end()));
4041  // Always report the pubkey at the top level, so that `getnewaddress()['pubkey']` always works.
4042  if (subobj.exists("pubkey")) obj.pushKV("pubkey", subobj["pubkey"]);
4043  obj.pushKV("embedded", std::move(subobj));
4044  if (include_addresses) a.push_back(EncodeDestination(embedded));
4045  } else if (which_type == TX_MULTISIG) {
4046  // Also report some information on multisig scripts (which do not have a corresponding address).
4047  // TODO: abstract out the common functionality between this logic and ExtractDestinations.
4048  obj.pushKV("sigsrequired", solutions_data[0][0]);
4049  UniValue pubkeys(UniValue::VARR);
4050  for (size_t i = 1; i < solutions_data.size() - 1; ++i) {
4051  CPubKey key(solutions_data[i].begin(), solutions_data[i].end());
4052  if (include_addresses) a.push_back(EncodeDestination(key.GetID()));
4053  pubkeys.push_back(HexStr(key.begin(), key.end()));
4054  }
4055  obj.pushKV("pubkeys", std::move(pubkeys));
4056  }
4057 
4058  // The "addresses" field is confusing because it refers to public keys using their P2PKH address.
4059  // For that reason, only add the 'addresses' field when needed for backward compatibility. New applications
4060  // can use the 'embedded'->'address' field for P2SH or P2WSH wrapped addresses, and 'pubkeys' for
4061  // inspecting multisig participants.
4062  if (include_addresses) obj.pushKV("addresses", std::move(a));
4063  }
4064 
4065  explicit DescribeWalletAddressVisitor(CWallet* _pwallet) : pwallet(_pwallet) {}
4066 
4067  UniValue operator()(const CNoDestination& dest) const { return UniValue(UniValue::VOBJ); }
4068 
4069  UniValue operator()(const CKeyID& keyID) const
4070  {
4071  UniValue obj(UniValue::VOBJ);
4072  CPubKey vchPubKey;
4073  if (pwallet && pwallet->GetPubKey(keyID, vchPubKey)) {
4074  obj.pushKV("pubkey", HexStr(vchPubKey));
4075  obj.pushKV("iscompressed", vchPubKey.IsCompressed());
4076  }
4077  return obj;
4078  }
4079 
4080  UniValue operator()(const CScriptID& scriptID) const
4081  {
4082  UniValue obj(UniValue::VOBJ);
4083  CScript subscript;
4084  if (pwallet && pwallet->GetCScript(scriptID, subscript)) {
4085  ProcessSubScript(subscript, obj, IsDeprecatedRPCEnabled("validateaddress"));
4086  }
4087  return obj;
4088  }
4089 
4090  UniValue operator()(const WitnessV0KeyHash& id) const
4091  {
4092  UniValue obj(UniValue::VOBJ);
4093  CPubKey pubkey;
4094  if (pwallet && pwallet->GetPubKey(CKeyID(id), pubkey)) {
4095  obj.pushKV("pubkey", HexStr(pubkey));
4096  }
4097  return obj;
4098  }
4099 
4100  UniValue operator()(const WitnessV0ScriptHash& id) const
4101  {
4102  UniValue obj(UniValue::VOBJ);
4103  CScript subscript;
4104  CRIPEMD160 hasher;
4105  uint160 hash;
4106  hasher.Write(id.begin(), 32).Finalize(hash.begin());
4107  if (pwallet && pwallet->GetCScript(CScriptID(hash), subscript)) {
4108  ProcessSubScript(subscript, obj);
4109  }
4110  return obj;
4111  }
4112 
4113  UniValue operator()(const WitnessUnknown& id) const { return UniValue(UniValue::VOBJ); }
4114 };
4115 
4116 static UniValue DescribeWalletAddress(CWallet* pwallet, const CTxDestination& dest)
4117 {
4118  UniValue ret(UniValue::VOBJ);
4119  UniValue detail = DescribeAddress(dest);
4120  ret.pushKVs(detail);
4121  ret.pushKVs(boost::apply_visitor(DescribeWalletAddressVisitor(pwallet), dest));
4122  return ret;
4123 }

4129  if (verbose) {
4130  ret.pushKV("name", data.name);

4133  return ret;

4193  LOCK(pwallet->cs_wallet);
4194 
4195  UniValue ret(UniValue::VOBJ);
4196  CTxDestination dest = DecodeDestination(request.params[0].get_str());
4197 
4198  // Make sure the destination is valid
4199  if (!IsValidDestination(dest)) {
4200  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY, "Invalid address");
4201  }
4202 
4203  std::string currentAddress = EncodeDestination(dest);
4204  ret.pushKV("address", currentAddress);
4205 
4206  CScript scriptPubKey = GetScriptForDestination(dest);
4207  ret.pushKV("scriptPubKey", HexStr(scriptPubKey.begin(), scriptPubKey.end()));
4208 
4209  isminetype mine = IsMine(*pwallet, dest);
4210  ret.pushKV("ismine", bool(mine & ISMINE_SPENDABLE));
4211  ret.pushKV("iswatchonly", bool(mine & ISMINE_WATCH_ONLY));
4212  UniValue detail = DescribeWalletAddress(pwallet, dest);
4213  ret.pushKVs(detail);
4214  if (pwallet->mapAddressBook.count(dest)) {
4215  ret.pushKV("label", pwallet->mapAddressBook[dest].name);
4216  if (IsDeprecatedRPCEnabled("accounts")) {
4217  ret.pushKV("account", pwallet->mapAddressBook[dest].name);
4218  }
4219  }
4220  const CKeyMetadata* meta = nullptr;
4221  CKeyID key_id = GetKeyForDestination(*pwallet, dest);
4222  if (!key_id.IsNull()) {
4223  auto it = pwallet->mapKeyMetadata.find(key_id);
4224  if (it != pwallet->mapKeyMetadata.end()) {
4225  meta = &it->second;
4226  }
4227  }
4228  if (!meta) {
4229  auto it = pwallet->m_script_metadata.find(CScriptID(scriptPubKey));
4230  if (it != pwallet->m_script_metadata.end()) {
4231  meta = &it->second;
4232  }
4233  }
4234  if (meta) {
4235  ret.pushKV("timestamp", meta->nCreateTime);
4236  if (!meta->hdKeypath.empty()) {
4237  ret.pushKV("hdkeypath", meta->hdKeypath);
4238  ret.pushKV("hdseedid", meta->hd_seed_id.GetHex());
4239  ret.pushKV("hdmasterkeyid", meta->hd_seed_id.GetHex());
4240  }
4241  }
4242 
4243  // Currently only one label can be associated with an address, return an array
4244  // so the API remains stable if we allow multiple labels to be associated with
4245  // an address.
4246  UniValue labels(UniValue::VARR);
4247  std::map<CTxDestination, CAddressBookData>::iterator mi = pwallet->mapAddressBook.find(dest);
4248  if (mi != pwallet->mapAddressBook.end()) {
4249  labels.push_back(AddressBookDataToJSON(mi->second, true));
4250  }
4251  ret.pushKV("labels", std::move(labels));
4252 
4253  return ret;
4254 }

4355 UniValue sethdseed(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
4356 {
4357  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
4358  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
4359 
4360  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
4361  return NullUniValue;
4362  }
4363 
4364  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() > 2) {
4365  throw std::runtime_error(
4366  "sethdseed ( \"newkeypool\" \"seed\" )\n"
4367  "\nSet or generate a new HD wallet seed. Non-HD wallets will not be upgraded to being a HD wallet. Wallets that are already\n"
4368  "HD will have a new HD seed set so that new keys added to the keypool will be derived from this new seed.\n"
4369  "\nNote that you will need to MAKE A NEW BACKUP of your wallet after setting the HD wallet seed.\n"
4370  + HelpRequiringPassphrase(pwallet) +
4371  "\nArguments:\n"
4372  "1. \"newkeypool\" (boolean, optional, default=true) Whether to flush old unused addresses, including change addresses, from the keypool and regenerate it.\n"
4373  " If true, the next address from getnewaddress and change address from getrawchangeaddress will be from this new seed.\n"
4374  " If false, addresses (including change addresses if the wallet already had HD Chain Split enabled) from the existing\n"
4375  " keypool will be used until it has been depleted.\n"
4376  "2. \"seed\" (string, optional) The WIF private key to use as the new HD seed; if not provided a random seed will be used.\n"
4377  " The seed value can be retrieved using the dumpwallet command. It is the private key marked hdseed=1\n"
4378  "\nExamples:\n"
4379  + HelpExampleCli("sethdseed", "")
4380  + HelpExampleCli("sethdseed", "false")
4381  + HelpExampleCli("sethdseed", "true \"wifkey\"")
4382  + HelpExampleRpc("sethdseed", "true, \"wifkey\"")
4383  );
4384  }
4385 
4386  if (IsInitialBlockDownload()) {
4387  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_CLIENT_IN_INITIAL_DOWNLOAD, "Cannot set a new HD seed while still in Initial Block Download");
4388  }
4389 
4390  LOCK2(cs_main, pwallet->cs_wallet);
4391 
4392  // Do not do anything to non-HD wallets
4393  if (!pwallet->IsHDEnabled()) {
4394  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_WALLET_ERROR, "Cannot set a HD seed on a non-HD wallet. Start with -upgradewallet in order to upgrade a non-HD wallet to HD");
4395  }
4396 
4397  EnsureWalletIsUnlocked(pwallet);
4398 
4399  bool flush_key_pool = true;
4400  if (!request.params[0].isNull()) {
4401  flush_key_pool = request.params[0].get_bool();
4402  }
4403 
4404  CPubKey master_pub_key;
4405  if (request.params[1].isNull()) {
4406  master_pub_key = pwallet->GenerateNewSeed();
4407  } else {
4408  CKey key = DecodeSecret(request.params[1].get_str());
4409  if (!key.IsValid()) {
4410  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY, "Invalid private key");
4411  }
4412 
4413  if (HaveKey(*pwallet, key)) {
4414  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INVALID_ADDRESS_OR_KEY, "Already have this key (either as an HD seed or as a loose private key)");
4415  }
4416 
4417  master_pub_key = pwallet->DeriveNewSeed(key);
4418  }
4419 
4420  pwallet->SetHDSeed(master_pub_key);
4421  if (flush_key_pool) pwallet->NewKeyPool();
4422 
4423  return NullUniValue;
4424 }
4425 
4426 bool ParseHDKeypath(std::string keypath_str, std::vector<uint32_t>& keypath)
4427 {
4428  std::stringstream ss(keypath_str);
4429  std::string item;
4430  bool first = true;
4431  while (std::getline(ss, item, '/')) {
4432  if (item.compare("m") == 0) {
4433  if (first) {
4434  first = false;
4435  continue;
4436  }
4437  return false;
4438  }
4439  // Finds whether it is hardened
4440  uint32_t path = 0;
4441  size_t pos = item.find("'");
4442  if (pos != std::string::npos) {
4443  // The hardened tick can only be in the last index of the string
4444  if (pos != item.size() - 1) {
4445  return false;
4446  }
4447  path |= 0x80000000;
4448  item = item.substr(0, item.size() - 1); // Drop the last character which is the hardened tick
4449  }
4450 
4451  // Ensure this is only numbers
4452  if (item.find_first_not_of( "0123456789" ) != std::string::npos) {
4453  return false;
4454  }
4455  uint32_t number;
4456  if (!ParseUInt32(item, &number)) {
4457  return false;
4458  }
4459  path |= number;
4460 
4461  keypath.push_back(path);
4462  first = false;
4463  }
4464  return true;
4465 }
4466 
4467 void AddKeypathToMap(const CWallet* pwallet, const CKeyID& keyID, std::map<CPubKey, std::vector<uint32_t>>& hd_keypaths)
4468 {
4469  CPubKey vchPubKey;
4470  if (!pwallet->GetPubKey(keyID, vchPubKey)) {
4471  return;
4472  }
4473  CKeyMetadata meta;
4474  auto it = pwallet->mapKeyMetadata.find(keyID);
4475  if (it != pwallet->mapKeyMetadata.end()) {
4476  meta = it->second;
4477  }
4478  std::vector<uint32_t> keypath;
4479  if (!meta.hdKeypath.empty()) {
4480  if (!ParseHDKeypath(meta.hdKeypath, keypath)) {
4481  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_INTERNAL_ERROR, "Internal keypath is broken");
4482  }
4483  // Get the proper master key id
4484  CKey key;
4485  pwallet->GetKey(meta.hd_seed_id, key);
4486  CExtKey masterKey;
4487  masterKey.SetSeed(key.begin(), key.size());
4488  // Add to map
4489  keypath.insert(keypath.begin(), ReadLE32(masterKey.key.GetPubKey().GetID().begin()));
4490  } else { // Single pubkeys get the master fingerprint of themselves
4491  keypath.insert(keypath.begin(), ReadLE32(vchPubKey.GetID().begin()));
4492  }
4493  hd_keypaths.emplace(vchPubKey, keypath);
4494 }
4495 
4496 bool FillPSBT(const CWallet* pwallet, PartiallySignedTransaction& psbtx, const CTransaction* txConst, int sighash_type, bool sign, bool bip32derivs)
4497 {
4498  LOCK(pwallet->cs_wallet);
4499  // Get all of the previous transactions
4500  bool complete = true;
4501  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < txConst->vin.size(); ++i) {
4502  const CTxIn& txin = txConst->vin[i];
4503  PSBTInput& input = psbtx.inputs.at(i);
4504 
4505  // If we don't know about this input, skip it and let someone else deal with it
4506  const uint256& txhash = txin.prevout.hash;
4507  const auto& it = pwallet->mapWallet.find(txhash);
4508  if (it != pwallet->mapWallet.end()) {
4509  const CWalletTx& wtx = it->second;
4510  CTxOut utxo = wtx.tx->vout[txin.prevout.n];
4511  input.non_witness_utxo = wtx.tx;
4512  input.witness_utxo = utxo;
4513  }
4514 
4515  // Get the Sighash type
4516  if (sign && input.sighash_type > 0 && input.sighash_type != sighash_type) {
4517  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_DESERIALIZATION_ERROR, "Specified Sighash and sighash in PSBT do not match.");
4518  }
4519 
4520  SignatureData sigdata;
4521  if (sign) {
4522  complete &= SignPSBTInput(*pwallet, *psbtx.tx, input, sigdata, i, sighash_type);
4523  } else {
4524  complete &= SignPSBTInput(PublicOnlySigningProvider(pwallet), *psbtx.tx, input, sigdata, i, sighash_type);
4525  }
4526 
4527  // Drop the unnecessary UTXO
4528  if (sigdata.witness) {
4529  input.non_witness_utxo = nullptr;
4530  } else {
4531  input.witness_utxo.SetNull();
4532  }
4533 
4534  // Get public key paths
4535  if (bip32derivs) {
4536  for (const auto& pubkey_it : sigdata.misc_pubkeys) {
4537  AddKeypathToMap(pwallet, pubkey_it.first, input.hd_keypaths);
4538  }
4539  }
4540  }
4541 
4542  // Fill in the bip32 keypaths and redeemscripts for the outputs so that hardware wallets can identify change
4543  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < txConst->vout.size(); ++i) {
4544  const CTxOut& out = txConst->vout.at(i);
4545  PSBTOutput& psbt_out = psbtx.outputs.at(i);
4546 
4547  // Dummy tx so we can use ProduceSignature to get stuff out
4548  CMutableTransaction dummy_tx;
4549  dummy_tx.vin.push_back(CTxIn());
4550  dummy_tx.vout.push_back(CTxOut());
4551 
4552  // Fill a SignatureData with output info
4553  SignatureData sigdata;
4554  psbt_out.FillSignatureData(sigdata);
4555 
4556  MutableTransactionSignatureCreator creator(psbtx.tx.get_ptr(), 0, out.nValue, 1);
4557  ProduceSignature(*pwallet, creator, out.scriptPubKey, sigdata);
4558  psbt_out.FromSignatureData(sigdata);
4559 
4560  // Get public key paths
4561  if (bip32derivs) {
4562  for (const auto& pubkey_it : sigdata.misc_pubkeys) {
4563  AddKeypathToMap(pwallet, pubkey_it.first, psbt_out.hd_keypaths);
4564  }
4565  }
4566  }
4567  return complete;
4568 }
4569 
4570 UniValue walletprocesspsbt(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
4571 {
4572  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
4573  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
4574 
4575  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
4576  return NullUniValue;
4577  }
4578 
4579  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() < 1 || request.params.size() > 4)
4580  throw std::runtime_error(
4581  "walletprocesspsbt \"psbt\" ( sign \"sighashtype\" bip32derivs )\n"
4582  "\nUpdate a PSBT with input information from our wallet and then sign inputs\n"
4583  "that we can sign for.\n"
4584  + HelpRequiringPassphrase(pwallet) + "\n"
4585 
4586  "\nArguments:\n"
4587  "1. \"psbt\" (string, required) The transaction base64 string\n"
4588  "2. sign (boolean, optional, default=true) Also sign the transaction when updating\n"
4589  "3. \"sighashtype\" (string, optional, default=ALL) The signature hash type to sign with if not specified by the PSBT. Must be one of\n"
4590  " \"ALL\"\n"
4591  " \"NONE\"\n"
4592  " \"SINGLE\"\n"
4593  " \"ALL|ANYONECANPAY\"\n"
4594  " \"NONE|ANYONECANPAY\"\n"
4595  " \"SINGLE|ANYONECANPAY\"\n"
4596  "4. bip32derivs (boolean, optiona, default=false) If true, includes the BIP 32 derivation paths for public keys if we know them\n"
4597 
4598  "\nResult:\n"
4599  "{\n"
4600  " \"psbt\" : \"value\", (string) The base64-encoded partially signed transaction\n"
4601  " \"complete\" : true|false, (boolean) If the transaction has a complete set of signatures\n"
4602  " ]\n"
4603  "}\n"
4604 
4605  "\nExamples:\n"
4606  + HelpExampleCli("walletprocesspsbt", "\"psbt\"")
4607  );
4608 
4609  RPCTypeCheck(request.params, {UniValue::VSTR, UniValue::VBOOL, UniValue::VSTR});
4610 
4611  // Unserialize the transaction
4612  PartiallySignedTransaction psbtx;
4613  std::string error;
4614  if (!DecodePSBT(psbtx, request.params[0].get_str(), error)) {
4615  throw JSONRPCError(RPC_DESERIALIZATION_ERROR, strprintf("TX decode failed %s", error));
4616  }
4617 
4618  // Get the sighash type
4619  int nHashType = ParseSighashString(request.params[2]);
4620 
4621  // Use CTransaction for the constant parts of the
4622  // transaction to avoid rehashing.
4623  const CTransaction txConst(*psbtx.tx);
4624 
4625  // Fill transaction with our data and also sign
4626  bool sign = request.params[1].isNull() ? true : request.params[1].get_bool();
4627  bool bip32derivs = request.params[3].isNull() ? false : request.params[3].get_bool();
4628  bool complete = FillPSBT(pwallet, psbtx, &txConst, nHashType, sign, bip32derivs);
4629 
4630  UniValue result(UniValue::VOBJ);
4631  CDataStream ssTx(SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION);
4632  ssTx << psbtx;
4633  result.push_back(Pair("psbt", EncodeBase64((unsigned char*)ssTx.data(), ssTx.size())));
4634  result.push_back(Pair("complete", complete));
4635 
4636  return result;
4637 }

4639 UniValue walletcreatefundedpsbt(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
4640 {
4641  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> const wallet = GetWalletForJSONRPCRequest(request);
4642  CWallet* const pwallet = wallet.get();
4643 
4644  if (!EnsureWalletIsAvailable(pwallet, request.fHelp)) {
4645  return NullUniValue;
4646  }
4647 
4648  if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() < 2 || request.params.size() > 6)
4649  throw std::runtime_error(
4650  "walletcreatefundedpsbt [{\"txid\":\"id\",\"vout\":n},...] [{\"address\":amount},{\"data\":\"hex\"},...] ( locktime ) ( replaceable ) ( options bip32derivs )\n"
4651  "\nCreates and funds a transaction in the Partially Signed Transaction format. Inputs will be added if supplied inputs are not enough\n"
4652  "Implements the Creator and Updater roles.\n"
4653  "\nArguments:\n"
4654  "1. \"inputs\" (array, required) A json array of json objects\n"
4655  " [\n"

4657  " \"txid\":\"id\", (string, required) The transaction id\n"
